entry.title: Planned Depreciation for Following Month Showing Double the Expected Amount
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

After performing a fixed asset migration in SAP S/4HANA Cloud (Public Edition) for asset transfer during the fiscal year, I noticed that the planned ordinary depreciation for the following month (e.g., period 10 ‚Äì October 2025) is double the expected amount.

The worksheet that I used in the Fixed Asset - Posting template is "Posting Key", "Posted Value", "Transaction Header", "Transaction Item"

Here are the key details of the migrated asset:

  • Capitalization Date: 28-Feb-2025

  • Transfer (Cut-off) Date: 30-Sep-2025

  • Useful Life: 24 months

  • Depreciation Key: Straight line to zero

  • Acquisition Value: 300,000 

  • Accumulated Depreciation (Mar‚ÄìSep): 87,500 (7 months √ó 12,500)

  • Expected monthly depreciation: 12,500 (***Which should also apply for following depreciation period)

However, the Planned Depreciation for Period 10 is shown as 25,000 instead of 12,500.

Could you please explain what might cause the system to display double planned depreciation for the first period after migration?

Thank you in advance.

Best regards,
HY

SAP S/4HANA Finance

entry.title: Joule Skills: Simplifying Employee Data Updates from Chat to Case
entry.content:
üåü Introduction

In today‚Äôs digital workplace, employees expect quick and seamless HR support ‚Äî whether they‚Äôre updating personal details or submitting important requests. SAP Build Joule Skills make this possible by extending SAP Joule, the generative AI copilot, with custom business logic that connects conversational experiences to enterprise systems like SAP SuccessFactors and SAP CX Service Cloud.

This blog explores how Joule Skills transform HR operations by automating co

ü§ñ What Are SAP Build Joule Skills?

Joule Skills are custom, AI-powered extensions that enable Joule to perform specific actions or respond intelligently within your organization‚Äôs SAP landscape. With SAP Build, you can design these skills to handle structured inputs, integrate APIs, and trigger backend processes ‚Äî all while maintaining a natural, conversational flow.

In short, Joule Skills let you teach Joule new abilities, such as:

  • Updating employee data in SAP SuccessFactors
  • Creating service requests in SAP CX Service Cloud
  • Fetching policy or compliance details from Knowledge Base Articles (KBAs)
  • Guiding users through document uploads and validation

üß† What It Is

SAP Build Joule Skills let you teach Joule new capabilities ‚Äî like answering company-specific questions or triggering SAP processes (e.g., updating employee details, checking sales orders, creating service requests, etc.).

Why use Joule skills in HR?

  • Remove manual steps: guide employees with just-in-time guidance and collect exactly the data HR needs.
  • Improve accuracy: structured prompts reduce missing/incorrect data.
  • Bridge chat ‚Üí case: automatically open service cases and attach metadata and files.
  • Track compliance: add KBA (knowledge base article) checks and required documentation prompts.

üíº HR Use Case: Name Change and Emergency Contact Update

Let‚Äôs consider a real-world example.
Employee Jada is getting married and wants to update her last name and emergency contact details in the company HR system.

Here‚Äôs how Joule handles it seamlessly:

  1. Employee Interaction:
    Jada opens the HR portal and types,
    ‚ÄúI need to update my last name and emergency contact due to an upcoming marriage.‚Äù

  2. Guided Workflow:
    Joule responds with relevant KBA links, explaining required documents and steps.

  3. Data Collection:
    Joule asks for:

  • New last name
  • Emergency contact name and phone number
  • Marriage date
  • Marriage certificate upload

    Joule validates the inputs and triggers backend automation to:

    • Create a service case in SAP CX Service Cloud, ensuring HR teams can track and process the update.
    • Update Jada‚Äôs profile in SAP SuccessFactors with her new personal details automatically.
    • Confirmation:
      Joule confirms submission and provides a case reference for tracking.

üß© Why Joule Skills Matter for HR

  • Reduce manual effort: Employees can initiate updates via chat without filling multiple forms.
  • Ensure accuracy: Structured prompts ensure complete and validated data.
  • Enhance compliance: Automatically check KBAs or policy documents before submission.
  • Improve employee experience: Faster resolutions and transparent status tracking.

Steps: Integrate the Process into a Joule Skill

1. Open the SAP Build Lobby, choose Sales Order Assistant Joule Skill project.

2. Click Create, then Joule Skill.

3.Enter name update_personal_details and description Allows the user to update their last name and emergency contact information due to an upcoming marriage..

4. Click Parameters and configure Skill Inputs and Skill Input as mentioned

6. Choose Add Input three times and enter the following parameters:

Case Creation Skill

Similarly, create Joule skills that can call APIs for SuccessFactors name change and case creation.

6. Choose New Conversation.

A case is automatically created in Service Cloud V2, and simultaneously, the employee‚Äôs last name is updated in SAP SuccessFactors through the integrated Joule skill

‚úÖ Conclusion

SAP Build Joule Skills bring intelligence and automation to everyday HR scenarios. By bridging conversational AI with SAP‚Äôs core systems, they empower employees to self-serve while ensuring HR teams maintain control, compliance, and efficiency.

In our example, what used to take multiple emails and forms now happens in one smooth interaction ‚Äî from chat to case creation to record update.
With Joule Skills, organizations can reimagine HR service delivery and bring true AI-driven automation to the heart of employee experience.

entry.title: S/4HANA Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM) and Situation Handling Scenarios: Part-2
entry.content:
In this Part-2 blog, I will focus on the SAP Situation Handling Scenario: MAN_MATLOVERDUESITSITN (Stock Transport Order Overdue), as a continuation of Part-1 blog: S/4HANA Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM) and Situation Handling Scenarios. 

What is Situation Handling Scenario:

In a nut shell, SAP Situation Handling Scenario helps organizations increase the quality and efficiency of the business processes by automatically detecting, tracking, and informing the right users about the exceptional circumstances that require their immediate attention. With its tracking and monitoring features, Situation Handling allows organization to get insights into the life cycle of situations and to  identify the recurring situations that can be prevented or automatically resolved.

Let us dive in...

To begin with, let us understand the Key Concepts of Situation Handling Scenario.

  • Situation Template: It serves as a blueprint for creating a situation type.
  • Situation Type: It describes the business situation. For example, how a situation instance can be triggered and who is informed about it.
  • Situation Instance: An exceptional issue which is displayed the responsible person.
  • Situation object: Technical model of a business object used in Situation Handling. It provides the basic technical configuration such as data structures, events, and actions.
  • Situation Scenario: Business Scenario that contains defining entity sets to create multiple situation templates.

Disclaimer: This blog focuses on the Situation Handling Standard Framework and SAP provided date functions.

Let us now understand the process flow of the Situation Handling Scenario.

If you want to gain deeper understanding of SAP Signavio Process Manager & Process Collaboration Hub, dive into my blog post on SAP Signavio : The nuts and bolts of a well-thought-out SAP Signavio : Process Manager & Process Collaboration Hub 

I will be walking you through the highlighted Apps  below during the Stock Transport Order Overdue Situation Handling Scenario process.

Let us first configure "Responsibility Management".

In "Responsibility Management", the team category represents a business process. In our case, the team category is "Inventory Management Overdue Monitoring (INVOVDUEMO)". SAP provides a list of standard team categories.

Team attributes are represented as "Responsibility Definition". 

Responsible Teams to receive exception notifications.

Let us move on to "Manage Situation Types".

In the standard framework, situation templates for object-based situations are predefined by SAP. We have to copy the situation type that can be adapted and enabled for productive usage. Enabled situation types create situation instances, send exception notifications, and display the situation message.

Let us copy the situation template: "MAN_MALOVERDUESITSITN" and create a Situation Type: "ZMAN_MALOVERDUESITSITN - Stock Transport Order Overdue".

When situation occurs, the system displays the message as:

In this section let us define the conditions based on which the system creates the situation instances and for which of these instances notifications are sent. Conditions are copied from the situation template when we create a situation type. However, the conditions can be configured by adding filter values. We can use input help to define multiple values for each date field.

We can select the time zone for scheduling to trigger situation instances based on the defined conditions. If this section is not displayed, then the situation type is even based. 

To enable "Notifications", assign the "Teams" to the situation type. 

With the "Trigger Now" option in the header section, we can directly initiate the batch process. As soon as the batch job is finished, we can see the new instances in the situation instances list.

We will now proceed to create STO for the material 271-Air Compressor 1250 CFM 8KG/CM2 SL200 movement from Norco plant to Robinson plant by recording the truck`s Inward and outward movements for this shipment.

Stock Transport Order:

As per the conditions configured in the Situation Handling Scenario : ZMAN_MALOVERDUESITSITN - Stock Transport Order Overdue, the system should alert the responsible team if the days in transit for the STO: 4500000334 is > 1 day.

When the days in transit for the STO: 4500000334 was "Null", the system did not trigger the notification.

Now, let us create "Outbound Delivery" for the STO 4500000334 and perform "Goods Issue" transaction referencing the Outbound Delivery. 

Stock Transport Order Quantities and Timeline:

We have also recorded the truck`s Inward and Outward movements for this shipment at Norco Plant.

When the days in transit for the STO: 4500000334 was "1", system did not trigger the notification.

As the "Days in Transit" reaches to "2", the system alerts the responsible team that has been assigned to the situation handling scenario. In our use case, the STO 4500000334 was delayed and met the conditions that are part of situation handling scenario; hence, the system triggered the exception notification.

The situations are displayed at "Bell Icon", which is a gate way to the SAP Fiori notification center.

or we can use "App ID: F4154 (My Situations app) " to monitor exception notifications. 

Now, the responsible team member shall coordinate with the team and resolve the issues related to the delay. For Instance, let us assume that, the truck has reached the location on early hours 27/10/2025, but the Inward entry was not recorded due to space constraint at the plant. Now, the team has cleared the space and recorded the "Gate Entry".

Inward Movement Entry at Robinson Plant:

Now, let us close the STO 4500000334 by recording "Goods Receipt Transaction". Responsible team can use the exception notification generated by the situation handling scenario and access the link to post the goods receipt by referencing the STO 4500000334

Now, let`s use My Situations App to view the exception notification for the STO 4500000334 and post the Goods receipt.

When we navigate through the exception message in the "My Situations" App, the system automatically copies the STO details into the selection screen field values.

Process flow of the STO up to the Goods Issue point.

We can use the populated link to post the "Goods Receipt" for the STO at the Robinson Plant.

We can attach the approval document for the movement of the Asset 20000000(EQ:10000001) while recording the Goods Receipt against STO: 4500000334.

Following the successful completion of the Goods Receipt, the STO 4500000334 is displayed under the "Delivery Completed" tab.

Let us now view the process flow of the Asset 20000000 movement from Norco Plant to Robinson Plant.

Following the successful completion of the Asset 20000000 movement, we can now close the "Situation" by using the option "Close Situation".

Let us now monitor the situations.

With this Analytical List Page App, we can monitor the handling of standard object-based situations with respect to their status and related business objects.

 

üòäThis brings me to the end of a detailed process walkthrough on SAP Situation Handling Scenario for the "Stock Transport Order Overdue". I hope this blog proves useful to the Inventory Management Team in gaining nuanced understanding of how to set up the situation handling scenario that triggers material movement exceptions during the Stock Transport Order process.

If you want to gain a deeper understanding of SAP Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management and how it can be set up to predict the "Forecast Delivery Date" in the Stock Transport Order process, check out my latest blog by accessing the link below.

S/4HANA Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM) and Situation Handling Scenarios: Part-1 

 

--

Yours Sincerely,

Pardhasaradhi Reddy.C

entry.title: Re: Signature Type (AES/SES/QES) for SAP E-Signature in O...
entry.content:
@Shoaib2220 Based on my understanding :Native method e-sign will fall under SES category .(A Simple Electronic Signature (SES) method involves using a basic electronic representation of a signature for low-risk transactions. This includes actions like typing a name, inserting a scanned image of a signature, or clicking "I Agree" on a web form).

It will not belong to AES and QES.

AES(created using electronic signature creation data (a private key) that the signatory can, with a high level of confidence, use under his sole control) 

 QES (is created by a qualified electronic signature creation device (QESCD) (Article 22, eIDAS). For example, a physical smartcard held by the signer with an associated pin code or hardware security module operated remotely by a qualified trust service provider (QTSP) in the cloud).

I would defer it our ONB experts @smitajalit @Shelly_Allen to confirm on it once.

Thanks,

Gopi

entry.title: How to avoid the overlapping errors in SuccessFactors timesheet?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We have a time tracking enabled system.

Our client is into manufacturing sector. We have employees working on 24/7 shifts. There are high chances of shift adjustments. 

Ex:- There is an employee 10000, this employee's planned shift is B shift from 14:00 to 22:00, There is another employee 10001, this employees planned shift is A Shift from 06:00 to 14:00. Due to some adjustment the employee 10000 asked by the manager to come in A shift and the employee 10001 to come in B shift on 1st Sep 2025.

But, Manager is forgot to update the temporary changes in the shift schedules of the employees in the SuccessFactors system.

The employees are following the manager orders and punching the clock In and Clock Out, the data is sent to timesheet by using integration. We have time valuations built in the time recording profile to process the data into different time type groups.

At the end of the month on 30th Sep 2025, the manager realized that the data processed by the time valuations is incorrect and also realized that he forgot to do the temporary shift changes. Now, the manager is updating the temporary changes of 1st Sep 2025, for the employee 10000 manager assigned A shift and for the employee 10001 B shift. 

We have many cases similar to the above example on different dates in Sep month.

Hence, our integration team has re-ran the integration job for the entire month. After successful completion of the integration job we validated the attendance data in the timesheet on 1st Sep 2025 for employee 10000 and 10001, we are getting the below error.

"Your time sheet entries were not successfully imported from an external system. Please contact your administrator. Reason: Resolve overlapping time sheet entries on 01-Sep-2025. Make sure there is only one time entry between 06:01 and 06:02. If you record night shifts, check the previous and the next week of the time sheet for possible overlaps. If you have edited an approved time sheet, please contact your system administrator."

I understand about the error, this is happened because of the delay in the temporary shift adjustment in the employee work schedule and also due to the execution of the integration (CPI) job multiple times.

How to avoid these overlapping issues? Is there a way to delete the timesheet data either by CPI or by Imports from SF for that entire month and run the integration job again? What is the correct process to follow before re-run of the CPI job?

Please provide us your inputs.

Many Thanks

SAH

I'm afraid I can't answer your question, but I can refer you to our help content. Perhaps, you can find some helpful information there: 

  • Format Mappings when you work with the CAMT formats: 
    • How to Create a Format Mapping
    • How to Adjust Your Format Mapping
  • Processing Rules when you need specific conditions and actions for your postings:
    • Processing Rules
    • Manage Processing Rules - For Bank Statements
    • How to Create Processing Rules

I hope this helps.

Best regards,
Anita

entry.title: IBP Integration Using SAP Cloud Integration: Fetch Product MD from addon extractor and load to IBP
entry.content:
Hello Community,

This blog is about creating a custom Iflow in Integration Suite to fetch Product Master Data from S/4HANA system using IBP add-on extractor /IBP/PRODUCT_ATTR and load into IBP

==============================================================================================

Prerequisites

1.Communication arrangement (SAP_COM_0931) is configured in IBP.

2.S/4HANA system is configured in Cloud connector.

3.Add IBP system and S/4HANA system as Destinations in BTP sub-account as shown in Picture (a).

Picture (a)

=======================================================================================

Creating custom iflow for Product Interface:

STEP1: As Pre-requisites - deploy reusable preconfigured integration packages from Discover section as shown in Picture (b).

          SAP IBP - Reusable Integration Flows

          SAP IBP Add-On - Reusable Integration Flows

Picture (b)

STEP2: Create a new content package from Design Section as shown in Picture (c).

Picture (c)

STEP3: From the newly created package, add Integration Flow in Artifacts section as shown in Picture (d).

Picture (d)

 

STEP4: As part of basic integration setup - add Content Modifier in Picture (e) and Request-Reply in Picture (f). Content Modifier is used to input the extraction parameters required for data fetching and Request-Reply is used for communicating with S/4HANA system, where the integration flow sends a request and waits for a response before continuing. 

Picture (e)

Picture (f)

 

STEP5: Parameters are defined in Content Modifier > Message Body as shown in Picture (g).

Picture (g)

 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?>
<IBPRead
BatchCommand = "INSERT_UPDATE"
BatchName = "IBP_PRODUCT_MD"
BatchKey = "PRDID"
DataSource = "/IBP/PRODUCT_ATTR"
DestinationforAddon = "S4_DML"
DestinationforSAPIBP = "IBP_Internal_UWE100"
FieldMapping = "PRDID:PRDID,PRDGROUP:PRDGROUP,UOMID:UOMID"
FilterForTheDataSource = "PRDID EQ 'ASMBLY-001-TEST10' "
PlanningArea = "ZDMIBP1"
SourceFieldsfromAddon = "PRDID,PRDGROUP,UOMID"
TargetFieldsInSAPIBP = "PRDID,PRDGROUP,UOMID"
TypeOfData = "MASTERDATA"
MasterDataPrefix = "DM1"
MasterDataType = "PRODUCT"
/>

STEP6: Select Adapter Type as Process Direct to link Request Reply to the Receiver.  Enter the full technical ID of the reusable iflow in the Address field. This will call reusable Iflows - SAP IBP Add-On Read ‚Äì Generic Process Flow to read data from the add-on extractors and to transfer data into SAP IBP as shown in Picture (h).

Picture (h)

STEP7: Save and Deploy the newly created iflow as shown in Picture (i). 

Please note here the trigger mechanism is set to start the iflow/data extraction during deployment.

Picture (i)

STEP8: Product object deployed successfully as shown in Picture (j).

Picture (j)

STEP8: Monitor the iflow activities in Monitor > Integrations and API > Overview > Monitor Message Processing as shown in Picture (k).

Picture (k)

STEP9: Output data can be located in IBP > Data Integration > Data Integration Jobs as shown in Picture (l)

Picture (l)

STEP10: Compare the data in source extractor Picture (m) and target IBP Picture (n)

Picture (m)

Picture (n)

 

===========================================================================================

Summary

After reading this blog, you will be able to integrate IBP Master Data objects using IBP addon extractors as source and load into IBP planning area using Integration suite.  Here we used Product MD object with limited source attributes and mapped it to target IBP Product MD. Filter is used based on single PRDID. 

Similar iflows can be built for any master data objects like Customer, Location, Location Product etc.

===========================================================================================

Like what you‚Äôve read? Please share your thoughts, questions and feedback. Feel free to share on Facebook, Twitter, or LinkedIn using the super-easy share buttons at the bottom! And don‚Äôt forget to follow Cloud Integration & SAP IBP @ SAP Community for more content like this.

Cloud Integration SAP Integration Suite SAP Integrated Business Planning SAP ERP, supply chain integration add-on for SAP Integrated Business Planning

entry.title: SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Belgium: Electronic Invoice in Utilities using Extensibility
entry.content:
You want to enable your system to create electronic documents for invoices posted in Utilities using SAP Document and Reporting Compliance. In this blog, we‚Äôll show you an example on how this can be achieved using extensibility.  

Before you begin ensure that you have implemented the SAP Notes listed in 2424886 - Electronic Document Processing for Belgium: Implementation Overview. You can also refer the SAP Help Portal for more information, see Electronic Document Processing.
Ensure you have also implemented the SAP Notes listed in 2736880 - eDocument EU PEPPOL: Overview note for IS-U.

Steps to Create Electronic Documents

  • Create eDocument Class
    1. Create 'ZCL_EDOCUMENT_BE_ISU' eDocument class by inheriting CL_EDOCUMENT_EU_ISU class.
    2. Add the CONSTRUCTOR method in the ZCL_EDOCUMENT_BE_ISU eDocument class to map the 'Z' eDocument IS-U class name to the field ms_edocument-edocument_class.‚ÄØ
    3. Redefine the method DETERMINE_PROCESS to assign the processes BEINV and BEINVIN.
    4. Use the table TFK003EDOC to configure eDocument type against the accounting document type.
    Example:

    Country/Region 

    Application Area 

    Document Type 

    eDocument Type 

    IN 

    Utility Company 

    FA 

    BE_INV 

    ‚ÄØ5. Add the class CL_EDOC_PROCESS as Friends of 'ZCL_EDOCUMENT_BE_ISU' eDocument class.‚ÄØ

    Sample Code for CONSTRUCTOR and DETERMINE_PROCESS method:  
    Constructor method signature: 

METHOD constructor.
 super->constructor( io_source_data                 = io_source_data
                      iv_edoc_guid                   = iv_edoc_guid
                      iv_land                        = iv_land
                      iv_update_task                 = iv_update_task
                      iv_generic_badi_filter_adaptor = iv_generic_badi_filter_adaptor
                      iv_simulate_for_email_option = iv_simulate_for_email_option ).

  ms_edocument-land                   = 'BE'.
  ms_edocument-edocument_class        = 'ZCL_EDOCUMENT_BE_ISU'.
ENDMETHOD.
METHOD determine_process.
    CASE ms_edocument-edoc_type.
      WHEN 'BE_INVIN'.
        ms_edocument-process = 'BEINVIN'.
        ms_edocument-process_version = '0001'.
      WHEN OTHERS.
        CASE ms_edocument-interface_type.
          WHEN 'AIF_PROXY' OR 'STANDARD'.
            ms_edocument-process = 'BEINV'.
*           reference process is 'EUINV'
            ms_edocument-process_version = '0001'.
          WHEN OTHERS.
            MESSAGE e162(edocument) INTO gv_error_txt.
            raise_edoc_exception( ).
        ENDCASE.
    ENDCASE.
ENDMETHOD.

 

  • Create Factory Class
    1. Create a 'Z' factory class to get the instance of eDocument IS-U class by inheriting CL_EDOC_FACTORY class and redefine its method CREATE_EDOC_INSTANCE. 
    Example: ZCL_EDOC_FACTORY_BE_ISU
    2. Configure this 'Z' eDocument factory class in the view EDOFACTORYV using the transaction SM30.

    Source Type‚ÄØ 

    Factory Class‚ÄØ 

    ISU_INVOIC‚ÄØ 

    ‚ÄòZ‚Äô factory class name (your factory class that you just created)‚ÄØ 


    Sample Code:
METHOD create_edoc_instances.

    DATA: lv_land_iso      TYPE edoc_land,
          lv_error_txt     TYPE string,
          ls_source_header TYPE edoc_src_header,
          lo_edocument     TYPE REF TO zcl_edocument_be_isu.

    CLEAR: lv_land_iso,
           lv_error_txt,
           ls_source_header,
           lo_edocument,
           et_edocument_obj.

* Country
    ls_source_header = io_source->get_header( ).
    CALL FUNCTION 'COUNTRY_CODE_SAP_TO_ISO'
      EXPORTING
        sap_code  = ls_source_header-land
      IMPORTING
        iso_code  = lv_land_iso
      EXCEPTIONS
        not_found = 1
        OTHERS    = 2.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      MESSAGE e881(b1) WITH ls_source_header-land INTO lv_error_txt.
    ENDIF.
    IF lv_land_iso <> 'BE'.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    CREATE OBJECT lo_edocument 
      EXPORTING
        io_source_data = io_source
        iv_update_task = iv_update_task.

    APPEND lo_edocument TO et_edocument_obj.

  ENDMETHOD.

  • Mapping Class
    1. We have a generic mapping class CL_EDOC_MAP_UBL_ISU. If you need to enhance the mapping logic, you can use the EDOC_ADAPTOR BAdI's method SET_OUTPUT_DATA. For more details, refer to Enhancements for Electronic Documents.
    Alternatively, you can implement your own custom mapping class. 
    2. Configure your mapping class in the view EDOMAPCLASSDETV using the transaction SM30.‚ÄØ
    Example:

    eDocument Process 

    Version 

    Interface ID 

    eDocument Type 

    Source Type 

    Mapping Class 

    EUINV 

    1 

    UBL_INVOICE_TRANSM

    BE_INV 

    ISU_INVOIC 

    <Your Z mapping class or CL_EDOC_MAP_UBL_ISU> 

     

  • Maintain the Required Customizations
    Apart from maintaining Master Data, Customizing and Integration as explained in the SAP Help Portal, you must also configure the company code for the following IS-U source type.

    1.  Activate company code for ISU_INVOIC source type in the view EDOCOMPANYACTIV for eDocument creation.
    Example:

    Company Code‚ÄØ 

    Source Type‚ÄØ 

    Application Active‚ÄØ 

    <Your company code>‚ÄØ 

    ISU_INVOICE‚ÄØ 

    X‚ÄØ 


By following these steps, you can efficiently create electronic documents for invoices in the utilities sector, ensuring compliance and enhancing operational efficiency. 

Don't forget to test it thoroughly. 

We hope this blog post was useful for you! You can leave a comment here or continue browsing our‚ÄØcommunity‚ÄØfor more blog posts on SAP Document and Reporting Compliance topics. 

Looking forward to seeing you here again!

entry.title: Re: blocking service checkout
entry.content:
Hi,

you can use the company setting CoreSystems.ResourcePlanner.ServiceAssignmentCheckoutCondition. Here you can define which condtions should be fulfilled to be able to checkout. It will also be displayed in the mobile app, if a condition is still missing to checkout. Further documentation you can find here: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_FIELD_SERVICE_MANAGEMENT/fsm_mobile/pre-defined-workflow-step-conditions.html?locale=en-US&version=LATEST.

Best regards,

Philip

‰∫ßÂìÅÂäüËÉΩÂ±ÇÈù¢ÁöÑ‰ºòÂäø

  • ‰ºÅ‰∏öÁ∫ßAIÊ≤ªÁêÜÔºö‰∏éÊ∂àË¥πÁ∫ßAIÂ∑•ÂÖ∑‰∏çÂêåÔºåAI FoundationÊèê‰æõÂÆåÊï¥ÁöÑ‰ºÅ‰∏öÁ∫ßÊ≤ªÁêÜÊ°ÜÊû∂ÔºåÂåÖÊã¨Ê®°ÂûãÁâàÊú¨ÁÆ°ÁêÜ„ÄÅÊÄßËÉΩÁõëÊéß„ÄÅÂêàËßÑÂÆ°ËÆ°Á≠âÂäüËÉΩÔºåÁ°Æ‰øùAIÂ∫îÁî®ÁöÑÂèØÈù†ÊÄßÂíåÂèØËøΩÊ∫ØÊÄß
  • ‰∏öÂä°‰∏ä‰∏ãÊñáÁêÜËß£ÔºöAI Foundation‰∏≠ÁöÑDocument AIÁ≠âËÉΩÂäõÂü∫‰∫éSAP‰∏∞ÂØåÁöÑ‰∏öÂä°Êï∞ÊçÆËøõË°åËÆ≠ÁªÉÂíå‰ºòÂåñÔºåËÉΩÂ§üÁêÜËß£‰ºÅ‰∏öÁâπÊúâÁöÑ‰∏öÂä°ÈÄªËæëÂíåÊúØËØ≠ÔºåËÄå‰∏çÊòØ‰ªÖ‰ªÖÊèê‰æõÈÄöÁî®ÁöÑAIËÉΩÂäõ

Âπ≥Âè∞ÁîüÊÄÅÊïàÂ∫î

  • Ê∑±Â∫¶ÈõÜÊàê‰ºòÂäøÔºöAI Foundation‰∏éSAP BTP&BDCÊó†ÁºùÈõÜÊàêÔºåÂèØ‰ª•Áõ¥Êé•Ë∞ÉÁî®Âπ≥Âè∞‰∏äÁöÑÊï∞ÊçÆÊúçÂä°„ÄÅÈõÜÊàêÊúçÂä°„ÄÅÂàÜÊûêÊúçÂä°Á≠âÔºåÂΩ¢ÊàêÂÆåÊï¥ÁöÑÊäÄÊúØÊ†àÔºåÈÅøÂÖç‰∫ÜÂ§çÊùÇÁöÑÁ≥ªÁªüÈõÜÊàêÂ∑•‰Ωú
  • ‰∫ëÂéüÁîüÊû∂ÊûÑÔºöÈááÁî®ÂæÆÊúçÂä°Êû∂ÊûÑËÆæËÆ°ÔºåÊîØÊåÅÂºπÊÄßÊâ©Â±ïÂíåÈ´òÂèØÁî®ÈÉ®ÁΩ≤ÔºåËÉΩÂ§üÊ†πÊçÆ‰∏öÂä°ÈúÄÊ±ÇËá™Âä®Ë∞ÉÊï¥ËµÑÊ∫êÈÖçÁΩÆÔºåÁ°Æ‰øùAIÊúçÂä°ÁöÑÁ®≥ÂÆöÊÄßÂíåÊÄßËÉΩ

entry.title: Internal Table and Flow Control in AMDP
entry.content:
Introduction:  AMDP or ABAP Managed Database Procedure, is a SAP technology that allows database specific procedure (like those written in SQL Script for SAP HANA) to be managed and executed directly from ABAP code. The primary aim of AMDP is to optimize performance by pushing complex data operations to the database layer.

Important Points:

  • While adding interface IF_AMDP_MARKER_HDB. Remember, interfaces can only be added in PUBLIC SECTION.
  • Only Variables and Tables are allowed as parameters. We cannot use structures or nested tables.
  • Generic types cannot be used for parameters. For example, Type Any cannot be used. Only elementary data types and table types with a structured row type can be used.
  • The table type components must be elementary data types and it cannot have elements which are table types.
  • Only pass by value can be used. Pass by reference is not permitted. Using VALUE keyword for all parameters is required.
  • RETURNING parameters are not allowed. We can use EXPORTING or CHANGING to receive the values.
  • Only input parameters can be flagged as optional with a DEFAULT value (literals/constants)
  • Every AMDP method will have below addition. READ-ONLY is only the optional addition and is used for methods that only read the data.
    o BY DATABASE PROCEDURE
    o FOR HDB
    o LANGUAGE SQLSCRIPT
    o OPTIONS READ-ONLY
    o USING table/view names
  • It is also mandatory to specify all the database objects and other AMDP methods that are used within the SQLSCRIPT code.
  • No ABAP statements can be written in the method code.
  • AMDP methods do not have any implicit enhancement options.

Internal Table and Flow Control in AMDP

In AMDP (ABAP Managed Database Procedures), you can declare internal tables using SQL Script. These internal tables are used to store intermediate results and can be manipulated within your AMDP methods.

CLASS zrj_amdp_01 DEFINITION
  PUBLIC
  FINAL
  CREATE PUBLIC .

  PUBLIC SECTION.
  TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_spfli,
         mandt TYPE mandt,
         carrid TYPE s_carr_id,
         connid TYPE s_conn_id,
         countryfr TYPE land1,
         countryto TYPE land1,
         END OF ty_spfli.
   TYPES: tt_spfli TYPE TABLE of ty_spfli. 
  INTERFACES: if_amdp_marker_hdb.
  METHODS: get_spfli_details IMPORTING VALUE(iv_mandt) TYPE mandt
                             EXPORTING VALUE(et_spfli) TYPE tt_spfli.
  PROTECTED SECTION.
  PRIVATE SECTION.
ENDCLASS.



CLASS zrj_amdp_01 IMPLEMENTATION.
METHOD get_spfli_details BY DATABASE PROCEDURE FOR HDB LANGUAGE SQLSCRIPT OPTIONS READ-ONLY.
         DECLARE lt_spfli TABLE ( mandt     "$ABAP.type( sy-mandt )",
                                  carrid    "$ABAP.type( S_CARR_ID )",
                                  connid    "$ABAP.type( S_CONN_ID )",
                                  countryfr "$ABAP.type( LAND1 )",
                                  countryto "$ABAP.type( LAND1 )" );
         lt_spfli.mandt[1] := '100';
         lt_spfli.carrid[1] := 'AA';
         lt_spfli.connid[1] := '1000';
         lt_spfli.countryfr[1] := 'DE';
         lt_spfli.countryto[1] := 'US';
         et_spfli = select * from :lt_spfli;
         
ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

Some Useful Internal Table with Operations:
RECORD_COUNT( ) Operator is used to get to know the no of lines in the internal table. So
it is likes LINES( ) / DESCRIBE table in ABAP.
SEARCH() can be applied on an internal table and it receives two arguments, the column
name and the value, if it finds then it returns the index of that record within the internal
table.
EXISTS() tells whether the record exists or not.
IS_EMPTY( ) can be used and we can pass the Internal table name as an argument to it and
then it checks the emptiness of the table , it is similar to IS INITIAL check in ABAP.
APPLY_FILTER( ) function can be used on internal table or DB tables to get all the items that
match the filter condition.
EXCEPT use is quite simple. It‚Äôs like a minus operation. The result of EXCEPT operation is the
record set that present in first and not present in the second.

Flow Control with IF and Loops
Using IF and ELSE
If syntax is similar to ABAP but uses additional THEN keyword.
Condition can have following

  • EXISTS
  • Comparison between variables
  • IS [NOT] NULL
  • IS_EMPTY
  • IN

The conditions can be negated with NOT, combined with keywords like AND, OR and can be
nested.

CLASS zrj_amdp_02 IMPLEMENTATION.
METHOD if_statement BY DATABASE PROCEDURE FOR HDB LANGUAGE SQLSCRIPT USING sflight.
  DECLARE lv_result INT;
  DECLARE lv_carrier CONSTANT NVARCHAR(2) := 'AA';
  DECLARE lv_carrier1 CONSTANT NVARCHAR(2) := 'BB';
***Example for EXISTS
  if EXISTS ( select carrid FROM sflight WHERE carrid = '1' )
          THEN lv_result = 1;
   else
               lv_result = 2;
   END if;

***comparision between variables
  if :lv_carrier = :lv_carrier1
           THEN lv_result = 1;
  end if;

*** IN
  if :lv_carrier1 IN( 'AA', 'AB', 'AZ' )
       THEN lv_result = 1;
       end if;

ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

For Loop

FOR <variable> IN [REVERSE] <initial_value>..<final_value>  
DO  <block> 
END FOR;

The variable is assigned an initial value for the first iteration, incremented or, if you
specified REVERSE, decremented with every iteration till final value is reached. Variables
declared inside the FOR loop are not visible on the outside.

While Loop

WHILE <condition>  
DO <block>  
END WHILE;

Condition block is same as IF statement. BREAK statement can be used to abort the loop.

METHOD loop_statement BY DATABASE PROCEDURE FOR HDB LANGUAGE SQLSCRIPT.

    DECLARE lv_sum INT := 0;
    DECLARE lv_index INT := 0;

***       for loop
      for lv_index IN 1..10

          DO
              DECLARE lv_tmp int := lv_sum;
              lv_tmp = lv_tmp + lv_index;
              lv_sum = lv_tmp;

           END for;

***        while loop
       lv_index = 0;
        WHILE lv_index <= 10
              do
                 DECLARE lv_tmp INT := lv_sum;
                 lv_tmp = lv_tmp + lv_index;
                 lv_sum = lv_tmp;
                 lv_index = lv_index + 1;
        END WHILE;

While Loop With Break :

***        while loop with break
        lv_index = 0;
        WHILE lv_index <= 1000
              DO
                  lv_index = lv_index + 1;
              if  lv_index = 10
              THEN BREAK ;

              END IF;
              END WHILE;

  ENDMETHOD.

ENDCLASS.

Conclusion: Internal tables in AMDP mirror ABAP's data handling but are managed using SQL Script constructs. Flow control allows procedural operations inside the database to optimize logic execution. Together, these enable high-performance, code-pushed data processing-minimizing data transfer between ABAP and database layer and making AMDP ideal for complex analytical logic.

syncing reserved materials from backend is a complex topic. Generally it is possible to have reserved materials linked to activities instead of service calls.

Philip

entry.title: Re: Alternative to ECC Cost Planning Transactions (KP06,...
entry.content:
Dear byd,

SAP Analytics Cloud Planning is the recommended financial planning solution for SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition. 

Integrated Financial Planning for SAP S/4HANA Cloud with SAP Analytics Cloud consists of three pillars:

  • The planning tool "SAP Analytics Cloud" that provides
    • generic data input and data import capabilities
    • a planning engine powered by SAP HANA
    • a full blown modeling environment for planning models, input layouts and data actions like allocations and advanced formulas
    • surrounding functionalities like commenting functions and a planning calender
  • A dedicated connector for SAP S/4HANA Cloud and On Premise 
    • that includes the suitable OData services within SAP S/4HANA Cloud
    • that can read all relevant data from SAP S/4HANA and write the plan results back to SAP S/4HANA
  • Predelivered Financial planning content package "Integrated Financial Planning for SAP S/4HANA" that covers all financial planning areas
    • Expense and activity planning, Product cost planning, Sales and profitability planning, P&L-, Balance Sheet- and Cash Flow planning
    • You can pick and choose from the different modules and use them in a standalone way or use the whole suite to create an integrated and reconciled financial plan.

Kindly check note https://me.sap.com/notes/2977560 for more details.

Find related information in the community Integrated Financial Planning - An Overview - SAP Community and Financial Planning | SAP Help Portal.

Kind regards
Christoph

entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model - Introducing Release Cadence Settings
entry.content:
Dear Administrators, 

You may have already noticed some exciting additions to the Administration Settings panel over the past few months. Today, we are pleased to introduce a powerful new feature designed to give you more flexibility and control over how updates for SAP Profitability and Performance Management - Standard Model are delivered to you: Fast Track mode. 

What is Fast Track Mode? 

Have you ever wished you could access the latest SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud - Standard Model (referred to as SAP PaPM Cloud SM hereon) features earlier ‚Äî before they are rolled out globally across all tenants? 

With Fast Track Mode, this is now possible. 

By simply activating the Fast Track mode toggle in the Administration Settings, your selected tenant will immediately begin receiving more frequent updates for SAP PaPM Cloud SM. This includes early access to new functionalities and improvements‚Äîideal for your development and quality assurance environments where early testing is beneficial. 

 

What‚Äôs the Default Behavior? 

By default, Fast Track Mode is deactivated, meaning your tenant will receive updates of SAP PaPM Cloud SM only once per month, specifically on the second Monday of the month. So, the default release cadence for such updates is monthly.

However, the same updates become available a few weeks earlier for tenants where Fast Track mode is activated. This provides a valuable window to test changes in advance and ensure everything is working perfectly with your specific business scenarios. 

Note: Given that we are gradually rolling this feature out across all regions, latest by 1 Nov 2025 all the tenants will be moved to the default release cadence - meaning, Fast Track mode will be in deactivated state for everyone. Administrators will have the option to activate Fast Track mode for themselves using the toggle as described earlier.


How to Activate or Deactivate Fast Track Mode? 

Activating Fast Track mode is straightforward: 

  • Navigate to Administration Settings.

  • Activate the Fast Track mode toggle. 

The change takes effect immediately. 

Need to revert to the default release cadence? No problem. Simply switch off the toggle. Please note that reverting may require waiting until the next monthly release (i.e., next month). 

We hope this new option helps you make the most of your multiple SAP PaPM Cloud SM tenants. Stay tuned‚Äîmore updates and tips are coming your way!

entry.title: How to increase the number of valid values of a combo box from default 100
entry.content:
Hello,
 
I am doing a SAP B1 web client extensibility project using UI API extensions (VSCode) in which on a UDO form , I am adding a custom grid.One of the column in the custom grid is of type combo box.
I am filling this combobox using a field from another UDO. The problem I am facing is that even if the service layer response gets back around 316 records from that UDO,
The combobox only shows 100 records listed.So I am not able to select other values.
 
How can I increase the number of valid values in that combo box.My combo filling code is given below. Also the layout file setting of the combocontrol is given. Can anybody help?
I tried setSizeLimit() for the datamodel,It is not allowed in web client UI API.
 
************* Combo filling code*********************************
 
 async POLineFill(oEnv) {
      try {
        console.log("POLineFill started");
        const oView = await oEnv.ActiveView();
        
        await oView.setCustomizedData(null, "data3");
 
        const service = await oEnv.getService();
        let response = await service.ServiceLayer.get("TWBS_CM_CONT?$select=U_POLine");
        
        if(!response.isSuccess()){
          console.log("Service call failed in POLineFill");
          return;
        }
 
        let podata = response.getData();
        let allItems = new Map();
        console.log(`Fetched ${podata.value.length} POLines from first page`);
 
        // Add empty option
        allItems.set("", { key: "", text: "", id: "empty-option" });
 
        // Process initial data
        podata.value.forEach((item, index) => {
          if (item.U_POLine) {
            allItems.set(item.U_POLine, {
              key: item.U_POLine,
              text: item.U_POLine,
              id: `poline-${index}`
            });
          }
        });
 
        // Handle pagination
        let nextUrl = podata['@odata.nextLink'];
        let pageIndex = 1;
        console.log("Next url  for pagination:", nextUrl);
 
        while (nextUrl) {
          let nextResponse = await service.ServiceLayer.get(nextUrl);
          if (!nextResponse.isSuccess()) break;
          
          let nextData = nextResponse.getData();
          
          nextData.value.forEach((item, index) => {
            if (item.U_POLine && !allItems.has(item.U_POLine)) {
              allItems.set(item.U_POLine, {
                key: item.U_POLine,
                text: item.U_POLine,
                id: `poline-${pageIndex}-${index}`
              });
            }
          });
          console.log(`Fetched ${nextData.value.length} POLines from page ${pageIndex + 1}`);
          nextUrl = nextData['@odata.nextLink'];
          pageIndex++;
        }
 
        // Convert to array
        const comboBoxData = Array.from(allItems.values()).sort();
 
        console.log(`Total unique POLines loaded: ${comboBoxData.length}`);
 
        await oView.setCustomizedData({ comboBoxData }, "data3");
        
        
        console.log("POLineFill completed");
        
      } catch(error) {
        console.error("Error in POLineFill:", error);
      }
    }
 
************   layout file***********************************
 
                                             "columns": [
 
{
"ctrlType": "b1.sdk.Column",
"guid": "k12qZkmVovquw6fXLmRxqz",
"text": "Choose PO Line",
"template": {
"ctrlType": "b1.sdk.ComboBox",
"guid": "dcmfTcU59HCwny9WxkWMZy",
"editable": true,
"enabled": true,
"showSecondaryValues": true,
"filterSecondaryValues": true,
 
 
"items": {
"path": "@@data3>/comboBoxData",
"length": "{@@data3>/comboBoxData/length}",
"template": {
"ctrlType": "b1.sdk.Item",
"key": "{@@data3>key}",
"text": "{@@data3>text}"
}
},
"change": {
"procName": "onPOComboChange"
  }
}
}
 
 
 
 
 
Thanks,

entry.title: Re: ATP in Sales Orders no longer considers QI stock with EWM
entry.content:
Hi,

we have upgraded our system to S/4HANA 2023 and have discovered the same problema.

In S/4HANA 2020 this worked perfectly and the inspection lots 17* from EWM were seen and proessed correctly in the ATP.

Since the upgrade it seems that this is not working anymore.

The problema seems to be related to the inspection lot rather than to the wuality stock because we have checked this scenarios:
-Stock in Q in EWM with inspection lot 17 --> NOT IN ATP.
-Stock in Q in MM with inspection lot 01 --> OK IN ATP.
-Stock in FREE in EWM --> OK IN ATP.
-Stock in FREE in MM --> OK IN ATP.
-Stock in Q in EWM with inspection lot 17 that as been sent to MM and then back to EWM --> OK IN ATP.

The last case works, because it loses the reference to the inspection lot.

The ATP scope has the Q stock checked so ti should be taken into account even if it is in a 17 inspection lot.

Hoping that someone knows the answer...

Best regards.

entry.title: SAP TechEd2025-XP264- Explore how to run cloud-native applications on SAP BTP, Kyma runtime
entry.content:
Description

A sneak preview of the material for the SAP TechEd 2025 session catalog number XP264 - Explore how to run cloud-native applications on SAP BTP, Kyma runtime.

  • Day-2 Operations: Management, Maintenance, Monitoring, and Optimization
  • Technical connectivity to public and private (on-premise) systems

The repository with the session material will be available publicly on Monday, November 3rd.

 

Overview

This session introduces attendees to Day-2 operations with SAP BTP, Kyma runtime - a managed kubernetes environment to help connect and extend enterprise applications in the cloud-native world.

In a nutshell, SAP BTP, Kyma Runtime (SKR) is a managed offering of a Kubernetes Cluster based on Gardener, extended by a set of building blocks called Kyma modules.
The idea being that each instance of SAP BTP Kyma runtime environment is a separate Kubernetes cluster with its own set of modules.
All these clusters are managed by a central Kyma Control Plane (KCP) that orchestrates the lifecycle of

  • the underlying hyperscaler project,
  • the Gardener Cluster,
  • and the Kyma modules.

 

 

During the session you will learn

  • how to operate applications with SAP BTP, Kyma runtime and discover the power of smooth integration with cloud applications and on-premise systems using the advanced connectivity features.
  • to explore operational best practices from mastering troubleshooting techniques and intelligent root-cause analysis to event-driven autoscaling that adapts to your business needs in real time.
  • about BTP multitenant applications with SAP BTP, Kyma runtime.

Requirements

The requirements to follow the exercises in this repository are...

Important

  • You must be able to fork the repository and activate the github actions at the fork. This is mandatory for this session!
  • Thus, you may need a GitHub user.
    If you haven't got one yet, please sign-up on GitHub before the workshop or at the very beginning of the session.

Important

The session content is provided exclusively on the SAP-Samples github, and many excercises have been implemented as CI/CD Github Actions worflows (GHA).

Tip

Security is paramount. With the Github Action IDP-delegated flow, there is no more need to provide kubernetes and btp credentials when using github actions.

  • ‚úÖThe Github Action workflows acting as the OIDC provider.

  • ‚úÖAll the kubernetets environments in the landscape are configured to trust GitHub‚Äôs token identity provider. They come with the pre-configured OIDC applications leveraging the built-in Gardener OIDC shoot extension.

  • ‚úÖSAP Cloud Identity Services acting as a platform IDP on the BTP side of the house has been federated with the Github actions OIDC Provider

  • ‚úÖAs a result, the very short-lived credentials are being fetched and rotated automatically on the behalf of the repository user for both kubernetes and btp platform operations.

  • The good news is you may run the GHA-based exercises directly, from your forked repository, in a browser on the provided teched laptop.

Disclaimer

Personal devices should not be used for this session.

  • üëâRun and take time to inspect the results of the built-in automations. Ask questions. And if you feel like doing, go ahead and create your own variants as well.

  • üëâThe recommendation is, however, to go with the flow of the exercises, inspect the results, ask questions and leave the rest for the homework.

  • For all other exercises which may require a terminal use, you may use the built-in VSCode terminal window.

  • As this is a Day-2 operation brief, the entire cloud landscape has been pre-configured with a number of shared components, for instance:

    • üîóSAP Cloud Identity Services (SAP IAS)
    • üîóSAP Cloud Logging
    • üîóSAP HANA Cloud
    • üîóArgoCDaaS
    • üîóSAP BTP Connectivity services - Destination service, Connectivity service, Cloud Connector, Connectivity Proxy and Transparent Proxy
    • üîóS4/HANA On-premise (private cloud) with the Cloud Connector in the private network.

  • All of the SAP Kyma environments have been configured to the same template (via terraform automation).

  • Last but not least, you will be able to play with a pre-deployed SAP Build multitenant application deployed to one of the kyma clusters.

  • üììFYI: There are several additional command line tools available on your SAP TECHED 2025 Client laptops, for instance:

    • kubectl plugin list
      The following compatible plugins are available:

C:\Software\CLI\Kubernetes\kubectl-convert.exe
C:\Users\TE-06\.krew\bin\kubectl-krew.exe
C:\Users\TE-06\.krew\bin\kubectl-oidc_login.exe
C:\Users\TE-06\.krew\bin\kubectl-resource_capacity.exe
C:\Users\TE-06\.krew\bin\kubectl-view_serviceaccount_kubeconfig.exe
       
    • jq, curl, kyma cli, terraform, etc.

Let's get started...

  • Exercise 0 - Preparation Steps

    • Exercise 0.0 - Sign up for a GitHub account
    • Exercise 0.1 - Fork the teched2025-XP264 repository
    • Exercise 0.2 - Let the session begin!
    • Exercise 0.3 - BTP landscape at a glance
    • Exercise 0.4 - Let's talk SAP BTP, Kyma Runtime architecture

  • Exercise 1 - First things first. Day-2 with SAP Kyma managed kubernetes runtime

    • Exercise 1.1 - Easy access to your session landscape (with SSO).
    • Exercise 1.2 - Built-in github automation flows
    • Exercise 1.3 - Zoom on Kyma CLI (optional)
    • Exercise 1.4 - Firefighter access
    • Exercise 1.5 - Terraforming kyma runtime environment
    • Exercise 1.6 - Multitenancy playground

  • Exercise 2 - Using External Scalers. Keda - the Kubernetes Event-driven Autoscaler.

    • Exercise 2.0 - Introduction to kubernetes autoscalers
    • Exercise 2.1 - HPA - Horizontal Pod Autoscaler
    • Exercise 2.2 - KEDA - Kubernetes Event-driven Autoscaler
    • Exercise 2.3 - KEDA - Cron based scaler

  • Exercise 3 - Explore Kyma Telemetry Features with SAP Cloud Logging

    • Exercise 3.0 - Simulate some load
    • Exercise 3.1 - Access SAP Cloud Logging
    • Exercise 3.2 - Explore Logs
    • Exercise 3.3 - Explore Metrics
    • Exercise 3.4 - Explore Traces

  • Exercise T1 - Enable Transparent Proxy Kyma Module (optional)

    • Exercise T1.1 - Navigate To The Kyma Dashboard
    • Exercise T1.2 - Enable Transparent Proxy Module
    • Exercise T1.3 - Explore What Changed In The Kyma Instance

  • Exercise T2 - Configure Transparent Proxy Kyma Module

    • Exercise T2.1 - Navigate to your working Namespace in Kyma Dashboard
    • Exercise T2.2 - Create a dynamic Destination Custom Resource
    • Exercise T2.3 - Create a static Destination Custom Resource
    • Exercise T2.4 - Explore the results of the creation of the Destination CRs via Kubectl

  • Exercise T3 - Use Transparent Proxy Kyma Module

    • Exercise T3.1 - Run a cURL Pod Included in the Istio Service Mesh
    • Exercise T3.2 - Connect to remote systems defined as destinations using the dynamic "gateway" Destination CR
    • Exercise T3.3 - Connect to a remote system defined as destination using the dedicated (static) "s4any" Destination CR

entry.title: Re: Steps to fetch data from S/4HANA into SAP Digital Man...
entry.content:
Hi @aziz_khan,
and thank you for tagging me! üòä
First of all, do you have the official integration guide? (click on the link)
It‚Äôs very clear and, based on your architecture (e.g. S/4HANA Public Cloud, Private Cloud, ECC), it outlines all the necessary steps to ensure proper communication between SAP and Digital Manufacturing.


Here‚Äôs a quick summary of the key activities required for a correct configuration (from my bad memory!):

  • SAP Cloud Connector: must be defined and configured as suggested in the guide.
  • SAP Integration Suite: needs to be set up with the SAP S/4HANA integration package.
  • SAP DM subaccount: requires configuration such as credential creation, role collections, and more.
  • SAP IS subaccount: also needs credential setup.
  • SAP DM app: the plant must be defined, and under Manage Business Settings ‚Üí Integrations, you need to configure the interfaces. Also, under Manage Collaboration Links, you can activate the necessary interfaces (e.g., posting confirmations to SAP after completing an operation).

There might be other steps I‚Äôm forgetting, but this list covers the main ones. It‚Äôs not in a specific order, but if you follow the official guide I shared (and if the link doesn‚Äôt work anymore, just search ‚ÄúSAP DM integration guide‚Äù on Google), you‚Äôll find a well-structured PDF that walks you through the integration process step by step.

Let me know if you need further support!
